items.text: short ball, goes over leg and he gets under it
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short of a length, rolls his fingers over the seam and sends it down at 121.5ks, tucked to short fine leg
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: direct hit and he would have been gone. Short of a length on the fourth stump, a bit of hesitation after Tamim drops it in front of point and calls for the single. point runs in and dives forward with an underarm throw at the keeper's end that misses
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: short of a length, outside off, shuffles across and defends solidly off the backfoot
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, no run

items.preText: Here's Dananjaya with the first over of spin.
items.text: fullish outside off, driven out to wide long-off
items.shortText: Dananjaya to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: loopy flighted ball outside off, plenty of revs on the delivery and he gets a good stride across outside off to meet the pitch before heaving a sweep all the way over backward square leg

items.text: was that a stumping chance missed? This was looped up outside off and kept a little low as Anamul looked to pat it away into the leg side. The ball sneaks from underneath the bat and evades the keeper as well.He was drawn forward and the backfoot was dragged out of the crease
items.shortText: Dananjaya to Anamul Haque, 4 byes

items.text: doesn't get hold of it at all. He's giving himself too much room as he steps down and Dananjaya is looping them up and slowing them down. Completely messes up Tamim's timing as he chips it off the toe-end down the ground

items.preText: Ravi Bhavsar: "Whenever Bangladesh plays , you always want them to do well. Most supported underdogs in world cricket (even for the neutral) P.S : i am an Indian fan"
items.text: shout for leg before, not given. Must have pitched outside leg Tries to flick a length ball but gets no room, and is tucked up as it comes on straight and accurately at middle
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Tamim Iqbal, no run
